page.title: 01Introduction to the area
page.content: A large section of this rural area , caught between the Soar and Wreake valleys,is farming land ,mainly arable.A clay base causes flooding, and above this are terraces of sand and grave. Some light industry thrives giving jobs to some of the three and a half thousand people.The great Roman road,the Fosse passes through from south to north as does the Midland railway line.Village primary schools serve younger children,while the older ones have a state Upper school and the public school.Politcally,this has always been a Conservtive area,and is run by Charnwood District Council,who control planning,housing and refuse collection. Cossington and Ratcliffe have a restraint order on them to prevent growth.East Goscote is a self contained village built new thirty years ago.By Mrs Elsie Dakin.
